ygData.subject: Re: Does this seem OK?
ygData.msgSnippet: ... You do not have to succeed to improve.  I assume this is for all trade skills, but I have seen it happen to me with smithing and tailoring. Skill
ygData.messageBody:
Reedo wrote:
>
> From: "Reedo" <reedo@...>
>
> Ok, I just relocated to Freeport to begin blacksmithing. I just want to
> double check that my progress sounds normal. I started by using 21 points
> for training. I gain about 1 experience point for every 20 scalers I make.
> That seems low to me. I've tried some skewers but have only gained a level
> once when I succeeded Do you have to succeed to improve? Any opinions
> would be helpfull.

You do not have to succeed to improve. I assume this is for all trade
skills, but I have seen it happen to me with smithing and tailoring.
Skill improvement and success at making the item seem to be unrelated.

Hicks
